description: From Middle English housles, from Old English *hūslēas, from Proto-West Germanic *hūslaus, from Proto-Germanic *hūsalausaz, equivalent to house +‎ -less. Cognate with West Frisian húsleas (“houseless”), Dutch huisloos (“houseless”), German hauslos (“houseless”), Danish husløs (“houseless”), Swedish huslös (“houseless”), Icelandic húslaus (“houseless”).

adjectives.description: houseless (comparative more houseless, superlative most houseless)

entries.meaning: lacking or in need of a house or home
examples: "He said that he was houseless but not homeless because he went to school in that community, was registered to vote there, and had been living in the teepee for seventeen years. He said that teepee was his home."

entries.meaning: homeless but not wanting for local ties, affiliations or roots in a particular community.
